Anxiety: I find myself constantly replaying conversations I've had, searching for hidden insults or criticisms.
Even simple tasks feel overwhelming now because I'm terrified of messing them up.
I feel this strange pressure behind my eyes that makes it hard to focus on reading.
Since moving to the new apartment, I've developed this irrational fear that it's unsafe.
Whenever I walk into a room with unfamiliar people, my throat tightens up and I can't speak.
I keep imagining the worst possible outcome in every situation, even when there's no evidence for it.
My fingers tremble when I write anything, especially if it's important.
I feel watched from the corner of my eye even when I'm alone in my own home.
I keep checking the news updates every five minutes because I'm afraid of bad news breaking.
I feel like I'm constantly walking on eggshells, waiting for something bad to happen next.
My heart races uncontrollably when I think about having to give that presentation again.
I have this recurring nightmare that someone is following me home from work.
I spend hours each day scrolling through social media, comparing my life to others' highlight reels.
The sound of my own breathing feels loud and harsh, like I'm hyperventilating all the time.
I feel like other people can hear my thoughts, especially when I'm around strangers.
I avoid calling my family because I'm afraid I'll say the wrong thing.
My hands feel clammy whenever I have to use a computer mouse.
I keep replaying past failures over and over, even though they're in the past.
I feel this knot in my stomach whenever I have to make decisions.
I have this persistent fear that I'll lose control of my emotions in public.
